IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO EMPOWER CPAS & RELATED PROFESSIONALS TO DRIVE VALUE AS TRUSTED BUSINESS ADVISORS BY FOSTERING PROFESSIONAL EXCELLENCE & INTEGRITY, BUILDING COMMUNITY & ADVOCATING FOR MEMBERS & THOSE THEY SERVE.
IRS990.MissionDesc: TO EMPOWER CPAS & RELATED PROFESSIONALS TO DRIVE VALUE AS TRUSTED BUSINESS ADVISORS BY FOSTERING PROFESSIONAL EXCELLENCE & INTEGRITY, BUILDING COMMUNITY & ADVOCATING FOR MEMBERS & THOSE THEY SERVE.
IRS990.Desc: A HIGHLY SKILLED WORKFORCE IS ESSENTIAL IN TODAY'S COMPETITIVE ECONOMY. OSCPA OFFERS LEARNING PROGRAMS TO HELP CPAS AND RELATED PROFESSIONALS ENSURE THEIR TEAM IS EQUIPPED FOR THE CHALLENGES AND OPPORTUNITIES THAT LIE AHEAD. EDUCATION PROGRAMS ARE OFFERED LIVE AND ONLINE, IN TECHNICAL SKILLS, PROFESSIONAL SKILLS, AND DIVERSITY AND INCLUSION.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: PEER REVIEW PROGRAM MONITORS PROFESSIONAL PERFORMANCE TO ASSIST MEMBERS IN PROVIDING QUALITY PROFESSIONAL SERVICES TO THE PUBLIC. THE OHIO SOCIETY OF CERTIFIED PUBLIC ACCOUNTANTS, THE AMERICAN INSTITUTE OF CERTIFIED PUBLIC ACCOUNTANTS, AND THE ACCOUNTANCY BOARD OF OHIO REQUIRE CPA FIRMS THAT PROVIDE ACCOUNTING AND AUDITING SERVICES TO BE ENROLLED IN AN APPROVED PRACTICE MONITORING PROGRAM.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: MEMBERSHIP PROGRAM PROMOTES NETWORKING TO ABOUT 20,000+ MEMBERS & AFFILIATES ACROSS OHIO WHILE ALSO PROTECTING THE INTEGRITY OF THE PROFESSION & SERVING AS A TRUSTED SOURCE OF NEWS & INFORMATION ON PROFESSIONAL & BUSINESS ISSUES. MEMBERSHIP SERVICES INCLUDE COMPLIMENTARY LEARNING, PUBLICATIONS, PROFESSIONAL NETWORKING AND VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES TO ENHANCE ABILITIES AND SKILL SETS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: INDIRECT POLITICAL ACTION COMMITTEE ADMINISTRATIVE FEES INCLUDING PRINTING, POSTAGE, SUPPLIES, BANK AND ACCOUNTING FEES.

OSCPA IS A NONPROFIT CORPORATION EXEMPT FROM INCOME TAXES UNDER SECTION 501(C)(6) OF THE IRC. THE FOUNDATION IS EXEMPT FROM FEDERAL INCOME TAXES UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE IRC. CONTRIBUTIONS TO THE FOUNDATION QUALIFY AS CHARITABLE CONTRIBUTIONS. THE ORGANIZATION HAS NOT IDENTIFIED ANY MATERIAL UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS REQUIRING AN ACCRUAL OR DISCLOSURE IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. THERE WERE NO INTEREST OR PENALTIES RECOGNIZED IN THE CONSOLIDATED STATEMENTS OF ACTIVITIES AND CHANGE IN NET ASSETS FOR THE YEARS ENDED APRIL 30, 2022 AND 2021 RELATED TO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS. THE ORGANIZATION IS NO LONGER SUBJECT TO U.S. FEDERAL OR STATE TAX EXAMINATIONS FOR FISCAL YEARS PRIOR TO 2019.
THE SOCIETY PAID DUES TO A SOCIAL CLUB ON BEHALF OF SCOTT WILEY. HE USED THE CLUB FOR BUSINESS PURPOSES 100% OF THE TIME. NO TAXABLE INCOME WAS REPORTED FOR THIS BENEFIT.
BARBARA BENTON PARTICIPATED IN THE OHIO CPA SUPPLEMENTAL RETIREMENT/DEFERRED COMPENSATION 457(F) PLAN. SHE RECEIVED CONTRIBUTIONS OF $16,028 DURING THE YEAR.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE SOCIETY ACCEPTS AS A MEMBER ANY INDIVIDUAL HOLDING A VALID CERTIFIED PUBLIC ACCOUNTANT CERTIFICATE UNDER THE LAWS OF ANY U.S. STATE, DISTRICT OR TERRITORY. MEMBERS HAVE VOTING RIGHTS. THE SOCIETY ALSO HAS AFFILIATE MEMBERS IN VARIOUS CLASSES. AFFILIATE MEMBERS ARE NOT PERMITTED TO VOTE ON SOCIETY MATTERS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ALL DUES-PAYING MEMBERS (NOT AFFILIATE MEMBERS) HAVE THE RIGHT TO VOTE AND TO SERVE AS ELECTED MEMBERS OF THE EXECUTIVE BOARD AND AS OFFICERS OF THE SOCIETY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE MEMBERS MUST APPROVE ANY AMENDMENTS TO THE SOCIETY'S BYLAWS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ALL FILINGS FOR THE OSCPA, THE OHIO CPA FOUNDATION AND THE OHIO CPA POLITICAL ACTION COMMITTEE MUST OCCUR PRIOR TO THE IRS FILING DUE DATES (INCLUDING ANY APPROVED EXTENSIONS). PRIOR TO THE ANNUAL FILING, THE FORMS ARE ROUTED THROUGH THE AUDIT COMMITTEE FIRST (INCLUDING THE VICE-CHAIR OF FINANCE) FOR THEIR REVIEW AND APPROVAL PRIOR TO FILING WITH THE IRS. THEN THE FORMS ARE POSTED TO THE EXECUTIVE BOARD WEBSITE, WITH NOTIFICATION TO THE BOARD THAT THEY ARE POSTED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE SOCIETY MONITORS CONFLICTS OF INTEREST THROUGH THE ANNUAL DISCLOSURE STATEMENT MADE BY OFFICERS AND DIRECTORS. WHEN A CONFLICT RISES, THE INDIVIDUAL IS NOT PERMITTED TO PARTICIPATE IN THE DISCUSSION OF THE TRANSACTION OR TO VOTE ON THE MATTER.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A COMMITTEE OF THE EXECUTIVE BOARD APPROVES THE COMPENSATION OF THE CEO/PRESIDENT. EACH BOARD MEMBER IS INDEPENDENT OF THE CEO/PRESIDENT. SALARIES FOR KEY EMPLOYEES ARE DETERMINED BY THE CEO/PRESIDENT BASED UPON SALARY BENCHMARKS FOR SIMILAR POSITIONS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE SOCIETY MAKES ITS GOVERNING DOCUEMENTS, FINANCIAL STATEMENTS, AND CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AVAILABLE TO THE GENERAL PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.
THE PROCESS HAS NOT CHANGED SINCE PRIOR YEAR.
